name: Header
description: Header component with multiple content sections for site header. Creates a consistent, branded navigation area at the top of each page, providing users with identity information and primary site navigation.

content_top2.description: Top section second content slot (utility area)

content_top3.description: Top section third content slot (secondary navigation)

content_middle2.description: Middle section second content slot (logo area)

content_middle3.description: Middle section third content slot (primary navigation)
content_middle3.typical_content: Primary navigation, search, mobile menu trigger

slots.content_top2: A design system by Salsa Digital

when_to_use: You need to establish a consistent branded presence across all pages of your website or application
Users need easy access to primary navigation and search functionality
You need to provide clear orientation and wayfinding for users
You want to maintain visual consistency throughout your digital experience
when_not_to_use: Creating a single-page microsite or landing page where navigation is unnecessary or handled through page scrolling
Designing for specific kiosk applications where screen real estate is extremely limited
Creating a standalone embedded widget that will be used within another site's context
Designing a print view or other media where page navigation is not required
best_practices: Place the header at the top of every page across your site, maintaining the same core elements
Ensure the header adapts appropriately to different screen sizes and devices
Make all navigation items keyboard accessible with sufficient colour contrast
Keep the header clean and focusedâ€”include only essential navigation and functionality
The header should clearly reflect your organisation's brand identity
Create clear visual distinction between the header and page content
Position the logo in the top left (for left-to-right languages)
Organize navigation items in a logical manner using common patterns

features: Screen reader compatible with banner role

responsive.mobile: Collapses top section, shows mobile menu trigger
responsive.tablet: Shows partial top section, maintains middle layout
responsive.desktop: Shows all sections with full layout

known_issues: Mobile navigation complexity: On very small mobile screens, complex navigation structures with multiple levels can become difficult to navigate effectively
Long navigation items: Sites with many primary navigation items or long text labels may experience layout issues on medium-sized screens
Utility navigation visibility: Some users may overlook the utility navigation positioned above the primary header area

findings: Testing with over 50 users across both government and non-government websites has revealed strong performance in brand recognition, navigation clarity, mobile usability, and search discoverability
Brand recognition and recall improved with inline logo placement
Navigation clarity enhanced with inline layout approach
Mobile usability benefits from responsive adaptation strategy
Search discoverability improved within header context
